title: Mesa Verde National Park: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Physical Address           Mile .7 Headquarters Loop Road  Mesa Verde National Park, CO 81330                 Directions         Mesa Verde National Park is in Southwestern Colorado. The park entrance is along Highway 160, between the towns of of Cortez and Mancos, Colorado. (10 miles east of Cortez; 9 miles west of Mancos; and about 35 miles west of Durango, Colorado.) Once you enter the park, the first view of a cliff dwelling is 21 miles (approximately 45 minutes) along a steep, narrow, and winding road.  Directions Details           Operating Hours & Seasons         Mesa Verde National Park Hours Mesa Verde's main park road is open 24-hours a day, although activities and services within the park are primarily limited to daytime hours. Please note that lodging and camping is available from mid-April to mid-October. Please visit http://www.nps.gov/meve/planyourvisit/hours.htm for more information.   Standard Hours    Sunday: Open 24 hours   Monday: Open 24 hours   Tuesday: Open 24 hours   Wednesday: Open 24 hours   Thursday: Open 24 hours   Friday: Open 24 hours   Saturday: Open 24 hours             Weather           Spring: Temps range from 40 F to 70 F, but snowstorms can occur as late as May. Summer: Temps can reach well into the 90s F. Thunderstorms are common in July and August. Be prepared to bring and DRINK plenty of water. Fall: Temps can range from 50 F to 75 F. Snowstorms can occur as early as October. Winter: Temps can range from the teens to low 30s F. Icy roads are common. Snow tires, all-wheel drive, or chains, may be required. Be prepared with water, snacks, and layers of warm clothing.          Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   Mesa Verde Entrance Fee - Per Vehicle - Summer Season - $15.00 This is a per-vehicle entrance fee for the summer season (May 27 to September 5, 2016). It is valid for seven days from the day of purchase. Please note that we offer fee waivers for qualified education groups. Visit http://www.nps.gov/meve/learn/education/feewaiver_info.htm to learn more.   Mesa Verde Entrance Fee - Per Person - Summer Season - $8.00 This is a per-person (motorcyclist, bicyclist, and individual) entrance fee for the summer season (May 27 to September 5, 2016). It is valid for seven days from the day of purchase. Please note that we offer fee waivers for qualified education groups. Visit http://www.nps.gov/meve/learn/education/feewaiver_info.htm to learn more.   Mesa Verde Entrance Fee - Per Vehicle - Fall/Winter/Spring - $10.00 This is a per-vehicle entrance fee for fall/winter/spring (January 2 to May 26, 2016 and September 6 to December 31, 2016). It is valid for seven days from the day of purchase. Please note that we offer fee waivers for qualified education groups. Visit http://www.nps.gov/meve/learn/education/feewaiver_info.htm to learn more.   Mesa Verde Entrance Fee - Per Person - Fall/Winter/Spring - $5.00 This is a per-person (motorcyclist, bicyclist, and individual) entrance fee for fall/winter/spring (January 2 to May 26, 2016 and September 6 to December 31, 2016). It is valid for seven days from the day of purchase. Please note that we offer fee waivers for qualified education groups. Visit http://www.nps.gov/meve/learn/education/feewaiver_info.htm to learn more.   Entrance Passes:   Mesa Verde Annual Pass - $30.00 The annual pass provides entrance into Mesa Verde National Park for a year, beginning from the date of sale. It covers the entrance fee for the pass holder and anyone in his/her vehicle.         Visitor Centers       Mesa Verde Visitor and Research Center Located at the park entrance, off Highway 160, this facility serves as the park’s primary facility for orienting visitors to opportunities within the park and surrounding area. Be sure to make the visitor center your first stop if you wish to visit Cliff Palace, Balcony House, or Long House to purchase tour tickets (offered seasonally). Exhibits offer glimpses into the richness of Ancestral Puebloan culture and daily life.               Use the tips on the following pages to plan your park visit. The Mesa Verde Visitor & Research Center and Chapin Mesa Archeological Museum are open nearly all year (only closed Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years Day). But some areas including Wetherill Mesa and overnight accommodations are closed during the winter months. Be sure to check the park's seasonal Visitor Guides and the Operating Hours and Seasons page for details on services and activities available during the time of your visit.
